intro: Zanthoxylum setulosum, commonly known as the prickly ash or white prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red or orange when mature, containing several seeds. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Zanthoxylum setulosum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and streamside habitats.
